page.title: 10FARMING:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: In the morning,very early,my Dad gets up to start{Farming}by doing the { {milking.}When he has finished he helps to do jobs like feeding the calves and fetching cowcake.All the rest of the livestock have to be checked and accounted for.Depending on the time of year other jobs have to be done during the day as described below.At about four o'clock the milking has to be done again and the calves have to be fed.January-if the weather is suitable the fruit trees are pruned.February-{ {Lambing.}March-April-muckspreading, fertilzer spreading,chain harrowing and rolling.June-{haymaking.}July and August-the bailing and hauling of straw;muckspreading and plum picking.September-Hedge cutting and apple picking.October-picking up cider fruit.November-December-general maintenance.
